result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary A Phelan

defendant.name: Phelan, Gary A

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
No word from either Party for 5/24/22 STC.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present.
Attorney Robert Forseth present.
Defendant present - in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights.
Court finds defendant waiving right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Court finds probable cause and binds over for arraignment. 
State will be filing an amended complaint reducing count 1 to misdemeanor bail jumping.
Waive reading of amended complaint.
Plea - not guilty.
Attorney Forseth requests bond modification.
State does not object to modification.
Court will amend.
$1,000.00 signature bond.
Cond: Report within 21 days to the Waupaca County Sheriff's Department to submit to the booking process.  You are required to make an appointment by calling (715) 942-1887. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with victim.
STC - BR 1 to schedule
